bridges_vs2.network

Class DataFormatter<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bridges_vs2.network.DataFormatter<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - 

    public class DataFormatter<E>
extends java.lang.Object
    Connection to the DataFormatters server. Initialize this class before using it, and call complete() afterward.

      • getJSON

        public java.lang.String getJSON()
        This method returns the current JSON

        JSON string

      • update

        public void update()
        This method calls the updateGraph() or updateSL() methods depending upon the type of ADT being created. These methods send the JSON to post() which ultimately executes the http request from the server

      • updateGraph

        public void updateGraph()
        Update visualization metadata. This may be called many times. This is usually an expensive operation and involves connecting to the network. Calling this method is optional provided you call complete()

      • updateSL

        public void updateSL()
        Update visualization metadata. This may be called many times. This is usually an expensive operation and involves connecting to the network. Calling this method is optional provided you call complete()

      • complete

        public void complete()
        Close down DataFormatters. This only calls update() but it could conceivably do more.

      • trimComma

        public static java.lang.StringBuilder trimComma(java.lang.StringBuilder in)
        Internal method for JSON preparation
        Parameters:
        in - The original string
        Returns:
        a string with all but the last character

      • next

        public static java.util.List<Tweet> next(java.util.List<Tweet> aList,
                         int max)
        The next(List, int) method retrieves the next batch of tweets and adds deep copy of those tweets to the current list
        Parameters:
        aList - holds the reference to the current list of tweets
        max - the number of tweets in the new batch of tweets
        Returns:
        the list of tweets containing the old and the new batch of tweets

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        returns true if the number is in the range 0 - 500
